result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah O C Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $20 per month commencing 06-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 5 days jail as penalty for failure to pay fine.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah O C Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Elijah O C Collins in court.   

State's recommendation is for a fine only with a plea to the charge.
Defendant wants to resolve this matter today.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
Fine:  $389
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid at the rate of $20 per month, starting  06/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Elijah O C Collins not in court. (defendant's mother called the clerk's office and stated the defendant was in the hospital and unable to make it to court).

  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Elijah O C Collins in court.  

Defendant referred to the Public Defender's Office.
Defendant received a copy of the pre-trial offer in court.
  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with co defendant,victim/witness/Burlington Coat Factor listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Elijah O C Collins in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
